meanings.definition: The state or quality of being aged.
meanings.sent1: Her wrinkled skin and gray hair showed the agednesses of time.
meanings.sent2: The agednesses of the ancient tree were evident in its gnarled trunk.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics belied the agednesses of its years.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house exuded the agednesses of neglect and decay.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed artifacts that captured the agednesses of history.

meanings.sent1: With each passing year, the relentless march of agednesses continued.
meanings.sent2: The gradual onset of agednesses could be seen in his fading memory.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of errors highlighted the absurdity of agednesses creeping in.
meanings.sent4: Time's steady hand painted the portrait of agednesses on the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The calendar marked the passage of time with the inevitability of agednesses.

meanings.definition: The characteristics or traits associated with old age.
meanings.sent1: Wisdom and experience are often considered the agednesses of the elderly.
meanings.sent2: The elderly gentleman carried himself with the dignity of agednesses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous twinkle in her eye contradicted the seriousness of agednesses.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree bore the scars of agednesses with pride.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out rocking chair embodied the comfort of agednesses.
